intro: Phlox cruenta, commonly known as showy phlox, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features upright stems covered in opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces showy clusters of tubular, pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
